hypothesis_content.title: BTC 4-Hour Bollinger Band Squeeze Breakout with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with a 4-hour Bollinger Band width (BBW) below its 20-day rolling 25th percentile (indicating a volatility squeeze), a breakout above the upper band on a closing basis, accompanied by a volume spike exceeding the 20-period average by 150%, will lead to a directional move of at least 2.5% in the breakout direction over the next 24 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often precede volatility expansions. A confirmed breakout from a low-volatility compression phase, validated by strong volume, suggests a genuine shift in market structure and participant commitment, increasing the probability of a sustained directional move.
entry_conditions: BTC 4H BBW(20,2) < 20-day rolling 25th percentile of BBW
BTC 4H candle closes above upper Bollinger Band

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves 2.5% in the direction of the breakout from the breakout candle's close
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes back inside the Bollinger Bands (below upper band for long entry)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 24 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL is hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average 24-hour forward return after such signals is statistically indistinguishable from zero or negative, or the win rate is below 55% after accounting for transaction costs.
